Zuora-Entity-Ids.description: An entity ID. If you have [Zuora Multi-entity](https://knowledgecenter.zuora.com/BB_Introducing_Z_Business/Multi-entity) enabled and the OAuth token is valid for more than one entity, you must use this header to specify which entity to perform the operation in. If the OAuth token is only valid for a single entity, or you do not have Zuora Multi-entity enabled, you do not need to set this header.

Zuora-Track-Id.description:
A custom identifier for tracing the API call. If you set a value for this header, Zuora returns the same value in the response headers. This header enables you to associate your system process identifiers with Zuora API calls, to assist with troubleshooting in the event of an issue.

The value of this field must use the US-ASCII character set and must not include any of the following characters: colon (`:`), semicolon (`;`), double quote (`"`), and quote (`'`).

$block: Container for custom fields of an Invoice Adjustment object.

$ul: **AccountId**:  The ID of the account that owns the invoice.
**AccountingCode**: The accounting code for the invoice adjustment.
**AdjustmentDate**:  The date when the invoice adjustment is applied. This date must be the same as the invoice's date or later.
**AdjustmentNumber**:  A unique string to identify an individual invoice adjustment.
**Amount**:  The amount of the invoice adjustment.
**CancelledById**:  The ID of the Zuora user who canceled the invoice adjustment. Zuora generates this read-only field only if the adjustment is canceled.
**CancelledOn**:  The date when the invoice adjustment is canceled. Zuora generates this read-only field if this adjustment is canceled.
**Comments**:  Use this field to record comments about the invoice adjustment.
**CreatedById**:  The user ID of the person who created the invoice adjustment.
**CreatedDate**:  The date the invoice adjustment was created.
**CustomerName**:  The name of the account that owns the associated invoice.
**CustomerNumber**:  The unique account number of the customer's account.
**Id**: Object identifier.
**ImpactAmount**:  The amount that changes the balance of the associated invoice.
**InvoiceId**:  The ID of the invoice associated with the adjustment. This field is required if you don't specify a value for the `InvoiceNumber` field.
**InvoiceNumber**:  The unique identification number for the associated invoice. This field is required if you don't specify a value for the `InvoiceId` field.
**ReasonCode**:  A code identifying the reason for the transaction. Must be an existing reason code or empty. If you do not specify a value, Zuora uses the default reason code.
**ReferenceId**:  A code to reference an object external to Zuora. For example, you can use this field to reference a case number in an external system.
**Status**:  The status of the invoice adjustment. This field is required in the Query call, but is automatically generated in other calls.
**TransferredToAccounting**: Indicates the status of the adjustment's transfer to an external accounting system, such as NetSuite.
**Type**:  Indicates whether the adjustment credits or debits the invoice amount.
**UpdatedById**:  The ID of the user who last updated the invoice.
**UpdatedDate**:  The date when the invoice was last updated.
**message**: Error message.
**done**:
